mapper.sql: id, telephone, nickname, messageContent, orderInfoId, backContent, doneContent, createTime, serviceState
mapper.insert:
insert into t_customer_complain
id,
telephone,
nickname,
messageContent,
orderInfoId,
backContent,
doneContent,
createTime,
serviceState,
#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{nickname,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER},
mapper.update:
update t_customer_complain
telephone = #{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
nickname = #{nickname,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
messageContent = #{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
orderInfoId = #{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
backContent = #{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
doneContent = #{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
createTime = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
serviceState = #{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_customer_complain set telephone = #{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, nickname = #{nickname,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, messageContent = #{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, orderInfoId = #{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, backContent = #{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, doneContent = #{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, createTime = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, serviceState = #{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select c.*,o.orderNo from t_customer_complain c left join t_orderinfo o on c.orderInfoId=o.id where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.telephone like concat ('%', #{telephone},'%')
and c.nickname like concat ('%', #{nickname},'%')

select
from t_customer_complain c
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.telephone like concat ('%', #{telephone},'%')
and c.nickname like concat ('%', #{nickname},'%')
